topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XVII, Part 3, North Africa
topic.body: This volume is part of a Foreign Relations subseries that documents the most important foreign policy issues of the Jimmy Carter administration. The focus of this volume is on the administration’s strategies to promote peace and stability in the Maghreb in its relations with Morocco, Algeria, Libya, and Tunisia, and in addressing the regional dispute over the Western Sahara.
